image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Putinâ€™s alleged love child living as DJ in Paris, claim reports
item.description: Vladimir Putin's alleged 21-year-old illegitimate daughter, Luiza Rozova, reportedly resides in Paris under a pseudonym and works as a DJ. She is believed to be the result of Putin's affair with Svetlana Krivonogikh, now one of Russia's wealthiest women. Rozova avoids public attention following backlash over Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Pakistan authorities are trying to arrest Imran Khan's wife Bushra Bibi
item.description: Pakistani authorities are attempting to arrest Bushra Bibi, wife of former Prime Minister Imran Khan, for failing to attend court in a corruption case involving 190 million pounds. Despite an arrest attempt at her Peshawar residence, she was not found. Bibi and Khan are accused of misusing funds intended for the national treasury for personal gain.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Syrian insurgents breach second largest city Aleppo's outskirts in largest offense since 2016
item.description: Syrian insurgents, led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, launched a major offensive in northwest Syria, capturing several towns and villages near Aleppo. The offensive, marked by intense fighting and airstrikes, led to numerous casualties and significant displacement of families. Iran reaffirmed its support for the Syrian government.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Video: Security forces brutally push praying protester from container in Pakistan
item.description: During a demonstration calling for the release of ex-Prime Minister Imran Khan, a protester was allegedly pushed off a stack of shipping containers by security forces. The incident, filmed and shared on social media, has caused significant outrage. The protests began after Khan's arrest on corruption charges, resulting in violent clashes, deaths, and numerous arrests.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Northern Lights could light up US skies on Black Friday night
item.description: Skywatchers in the northern US can expect a spectacular display of the northern lights tonight due to a G2 (moderate) geomagnetic storm. States like Washington, Montana, and Minnesota may see vibrant auroras, with the best viewing times around midnight. Increased solar activity during the solar cycle peak is expected to bring more frequent auroral shows through 2025.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Paris's Notre Dame unveils stunning new interiors after devastating fire damage
Chinese journalist Dong Yuyu sentenced to seven years for espionage
item.description: A Beijing court has sentenced Dong Yuyu, a veteran Chinese state media journalist, to seven years in prison for espionage after he was detained while meeting a Japanese diplomat. His family and NGOs condemn the verdict as unjust and damaging to press freedom. Dong's work includes advocating legal reforms and moderate changes, avoiding direct criticism of China's leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh freezes bank accounts of 17 people linked to ISKCON, including Das
item.description: Bangladesh's financial authorities have ordered banks to freeze the accounts of 17 individuals linked to Iskcon, including former spokesperson Chinmoy Krishna Das, for 30 days. This follows Das's arrest related to a sedition case involving a rally in Chattogram where a saffron flag was allegedly hoisted above the national flag, sparking widespread outrage and demands for his release.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Malaysia floods:3 dead, over 80,000 displaced as the country prepares for worst in decade
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russian defence minister visits North Korea for talks with military, political leaders
item.description: Russian defence minister Andrei Belousov visits North Korea to discuss military and political cooperation, highlighting increased ties between Russia and North Korea amid Russia's war in Ukraine. The visit follows a strategic partnership agreement between Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un, aiming to maintain regional power balance.

item.title: Onlyfans star Scarlet Vas addresses online backlash over step-sibling relationship and pregnancy announcement
item.description: Former 'Neighbors' actress Scarlet Vas and singer Tayo Ricci are expecting a baby, garnering online attention due to their step-sibling relationship. The couple, not blood-related, met as teenagers in Melbourne and have been together for a decade. Despite online criticism, they focus on their relationship and creating content. Vas plans to continue her OnlyFans work post-birth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sniper kills Florida man who fired over 200 rounds at condo units, says gunman 'refused to negotiate'
item.description: A Connecticut man, Joseph DiFusco, was fatally shot by a sniper after firing over 200 rounds at homes and police during a five-hour standoff in a Florida condominium complex. The standoff began after DiFusco reported suicidal thoughts. Authorities evacuated neighbors, and no one else was injured. DiFusco's family had previously expressed fear for their safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Alaskan pilot 'airdrops' turkeys to remote areas to keep Thanksgiving tradition alive
item.description: Alaskan authorities continue their tradition by airdropping frozen Thanksgiving turkeys to remote residents. Esther Keim leads the effort, delivering 32 turkeys this year with the help of social media donations. Despite weather challenges, Keim ensures the turkeys reach isolated families, aiming to expand her initiative into a statewide nonprofit.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US landmine offer to Ukraine throws global treaty into 'crisis': Campaign group
item.description: A US proposal to supply anti-personnel mines to Ukraine has sparked a crisis in the Anti-Personnel Mine Ban Convention, with campaigners urging Ukraine to reject the offer. Ukraine, a signatory of the treaty, is facing pressure to avoid using these mines despite President Zelensky's support. Finland also reassesses its stance on landmines due to Russian threats.

item.title: Putin: Russia will use all weapons at disposal if Ukraine gets N-arms
JD Vance marks Thanksgiving with GOP victory meme, Elon Musk and netizens react
item.description: US vice president-elect JD Vance shared a Thanksgiving message along with a GOP victory meme featuring a map of the US colored red, symbolizing the Republican win. Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded humorously to the meme, while reactions from the public varied.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine's 'decision-making centers' in Kyiv could be next, warns Putin
item.description: Russia launched extensive missile and drone strikes across Ukraine, targeting power plants and causing widespread blackouts as temperatures dropped. President Putin stated the attacks were a retaliation against Ukraine's use of US-supplied missiles. Ukrainian officials reported significant damage, with calls for increased support from Western allies. US President Biden condemned the attacks as outrageous.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: After Donald Trumpâ€™s cabinet picks, five Connecticut Democrats receive bomb threats
item.description: Five Democratic Congress members from Connecticut, including Senator Chris Murphy and Representatives Jim Himes, Joe Courtney, John Larson, and Jahana Hayes, received bomb threats at their homes. Police found no explosives at any location. The threats appear to be part of a coordinated effort and came a day after similar threats against Trumpâ€™s cabinet picks and appointees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US President Biden urges Donald Trump to â€˜rethinkâ€™ tariff threats against China, Mexico, and Canada
item.description: US President Joe Biden urges President-elect Donald Trump to reconsider tariffs on Canadian, Mexican, and Chinese goods, labeling them counterproductive. Biden emphasizes maintaining strong ties with neighboring allies, while Trumpâ€™s announcements face resistance from Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and cautious acceptance from Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris wearing the same outfit from her 'drunk' rant in Thanksgiving video?
item.description: Kamala Harris released a Thanksgiving video in which she and her husband, Doug Emhoff, shared their gratitude for family, friends, and service members. Social media users noted she wore the same outfit as in a previous video in which she consoled her followers and also released her rant. It looked both the videos were shot back-to-back and the Vice president was apparently seen in the same clothes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
